definition: to identify by smell/to detect a scent/to sniff out

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
State Administration for Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television (SAPPRFT)/abbr. to 廣電總局|广电总局[Guang3 dian4 Zong3 ju2]
pinyin: Guo2 jia1 Xin1 wen2 Chu1 ban3 Guang3 dian4 Zong3 ju2
containing_words.word: 国家新闻出版广电总局

definition: General Administration of Press and Publication (PRC state censorship organization)
pinyin: Xin1 wen2 Chu1 ban3 Zong3 shu3

sentences.english: He is working in China Children's Press&Publication Group.
sentences.chinese: 供职于中国少年儿童新闻出版总社。

sentences.english: Be aimed at these problems, city news publication bureau will take the step of tripartite face.
sentences.chinese: 针对这些问题，市新闻出版局将采取三方面的措施。

sentences.english: Small smart snakes smelt smoked steaks.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的小蛇闻出了熏牛排的味道。
我闻出有东西烧焦的味。

sentences.english: The hounds had winded the fox.
sentences.chinese: 猎狗闻出了有狐狸的气味。

sentences.english: Cooperative Office System and Portal Site System of Bureau of Press and Publication.
sentences.chinese: 协同办公系统和新闻出版局门户网站系统。

sentences.english: Liu Chenghua was appointed Director of the Department of Culture, Radio, Film, TV, Press and Publication of Jinan.
sentences.chinese: 任命刘程华为济南市文化广电新闻出版局局长。

sentences.english: Try it, you'll smell a big difference.
sentences.chinese: 试试吧，你会闻出区别很大。

sentences.english: We had been approved by the subordinate organs of the propaganda department include the press and publication bureau of Guangdong Province.
sentences.chinese: 本公司是经广东省新闻出版局核准的一类印刷企业。

sentences.english: In light of these problems, City Press and Publications Board will take three measures.
sentences.chinese: 针对这些问题，市新闻出版局将采取三方面的措施。

sentences.english: I should smell it the way a cat smells a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以象猫嗅老鼠一样闻出它的气味。

sentences.english: So eventually you know maybe you can sniff the right man out.
sentences.chinese: 所以最终你知道或许你可以闻出你的意中人。

sentences.english: Illegal Periodicals seriously disturb the order of national press and publishing.
sentences.chinese: 非法期刊严重扰乱了我国新闻出版秩序。

sentences.english: I can smell some nice bread and biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我能闻出一些好的面包和饼干。

sentences.english: Sun Yong is Chief of the Press and Publication Bureau of Shanghai .
sentences.chinese: 上海市新闻出版局局长。

sentences.english: Freedom of assembly and the press foster open debate and exchange of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 集会和新闻出版自由促进公开辩论和意见交流。

definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
smell of alcohol/flavoring of rum or other liquor in food/aroma or nose (of wine)
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
